title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Lucas Giolito, who had a strong 2025 season with the Red Sox, remains unsigned in free agency.
Garrett Crochet expressed surprise over Giolito's free agent status, citing his impressive performance last season.
The Red Sox have bolstered their rotation with Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez, reducing chances of Giolito's return.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots consider trading for Colts WR Michael Pittman Jr., who has a $24 million cap hit for 2026.
Bears WR DJ Moore is a possible trade target for the Patriots, with a $24.5 million cap hit.
Jaguars' Walker Little could be a Patriots option to strengthen the offensive line, carrying a $12 million cap hit.

title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a five-on-five scrimmage, indicating progress in his Achilles tear rehab.
Tatum practiced with the Celtics' G League affiliate on February 10 but didn't confirm a return date.
Speculation grows about Tatum's return fueled by a documentary teaser and scheduling flexes for televised games.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC Sports' Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko delivered a memorable call during Team USA's women's hockey gold-medal win over Canada.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir utilized silence to enhance Alysa Liu's gold-medal figure skating routine coverage.
Providence led in viewership ratings for Super Bowl LX, with a 51.2 rating, while Boston ranked third at 47.5.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extended the free MBTA bus service on routes 23, 28, and 29 until June using federal pandemic funds.
Routes serving Mattapan, Dorchester, and Roxbury have been free since 2022 as part of a pilot initiative launched by Mayor Wu.
The future of the free bus program post-June is uncertain as Boston officials discuss long-term funding options with the MBTA.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Massachusetts towns recorded varying snow totals from Friday night to Saturday, with Franklin County reporting the highest at 6.5 inches in Leyden.
Essex County saw notable snowfall with Haverhill receiving up to 5 inches and other towns like Methuen close behind at 4.6 inches.
Another storm is anticipated Sunday into Monday, expected to bring blizzard conditions and potential power outages according to the National Weather Service.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa from Canton will run the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor the victims of the 2013 bombing.
LaRosa was inspired to run by her coworker who has completed the marathon 24 times, serving as her coach.
The 2026 marathon represents a significant personal achievement and tribute for LaRosa, marking a meaningful date in her life.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac sentenced to 15 months for using COVID-19 relief funds to buy a golf course.
Kirouac fraudulently obtained over $1 million in EIDL funds meant for pandemic-affected businesses.
He used approximately $600,000 of the funds to purchase Angus Lea Golf Course, violating loan terms.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, was arraigned for a shoplifting spree at high-end Boston stores, facing larceny and drug possession charges.
With theft-related offenses dating back to 2001, Cutelis allegedly targeted Newbury Street and Prudential Center retailers in November.
A judge set a $2,500 bail, banned Cutelis from the involved stores, and held him on a fugitive charge from New Hampshire.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will continue as the Boston Red Sox leadoff hitter for the 2026 season, manager Alex Cora confirmed.
Anthony hit .336 with six home runs and a 1.003 OPS when leading off for the Red Sox in 2025.
Willson Contreras will bat cleanup; potential lineup includes Trevor Story, Jarren Duran, and Caleb Durbin in the top spots.
